author: Benjamin Graham
summary: A timeless classic that teaches the principles of value investing, risk management, and emotional control. Ideal for long-term investors who want to build wealth patiently and wisely.
keyInsights: The stock market is a voting machine in the short term, but a weighing machine in the long term.
Always invest with a margin of safety to protect against the unknown.
Mr. Market is not your guide—he is your servant. Do not follow his emotions.
There are two types of investors: defensive and enterprising. Know which one you are.
Speculation is not evil, but it should be clearly separated from investment activity.
Patience, discipline, and rationality are far more important than market timing or prediction.
Price is what you pay; value is what you get. Don’t confuse the two.
Financial markets will always fluctuate, but your strategy should remain grounded in fundamentals.
A good portfolio is not flashy, but consistent and boring — and that’s a good thing.
This book influenced Warren Buffett more than any other, and it remains relevant across all market cycles.
